english.segment1: This day's a desert full of fright (Morning Star, oh, Morning Star) and I must cross it before the night (oh, bright and Morning Star).
english.segment2: This day can be too much for me (Morning Star, oh, Morning Star). Be thou my vision so I can see, (oh, bright and Morning Star).
english.segment3: Come rise and shine in your holiness, oh radiant sun of righteousness, and warm your people both near and far and shine through me, oh Morning Star, shine through me, oh Morning Star.
english.segment4: Now like a beacon, come and blaze (Morning Star, oh, Morning Star). Lead on, good shepherd through the maze. (oh bright and Morning Star) oh, bright and Morning Star.
english.segment5: Our compassion's new ev'ry morning. It fills us up so we can see, so we can see.
english.segment6: Oh, come rise and shine in your holiness, oh radiant sun of righteousness, and warm your people both near and (near and far). And shine through me, oh Morning Star, shine through me, oh, Morning Star. (Morning Star, oh, Morning Star.) Shine through me, oh, Morning Star, (Morning Star.) Morning Star, oh, Morning Star.
